To kick off their new digital marketing plan, Train World first wants to focus on a series of stories and history they already offer on the current site. They want to revamp these and use them as a tool to, on the one hand, enthuse people for their visit, teach them something in advance, and, on the other, attract visitors who have not yet put Train World on their wish list. Train World aims to create an online experience by immersing readers in an
. As a visitor, I can learn by doing things. I can see the train carriage inside and sit at the steering wheel. In short, the museum offers a
The website, their online story, does not offer the same experience. It is mainly focused on providing
, which is obviously crucial, but still could be better.
Even before entering Train World, visitors want to be
in the story. After all, the experience starts with booking a
are part of the entire user story.

. I wanted to make the website interactive to really create an online
and involve the reader with the story.

was founded in 1945 to give colour back to the faces of children turned pale by war. It is still their mission to make a difference in people's lives with

audiences. Scapino aims to reach the widest possible audience: their goal is to make a difference in people's lives, using dance as foundation. They achieve this by shaping their performances and their context programme based on three pillars:
Focusing on mature audiences, they often find it difficult to connect

about, let them enjoy or connect with (their) modern dance?

Because this project is educational and therefore won’t be used by our client, the app isn’t available in the App Store/Play Store because of unnecessary costs.
It is clear that education needs more resources to keep it
for everyone. Schools are receiving fewer and fewer resources. With 20 to 40 percent in purchasing power losses from 2008 to 2022, schools are seeing their
dramatically while the challenges to education have never been greater.

such as books and computers. In this way, the individual

attributes.name: WEATHER DOG
attributes.focus: WebRTC - Weather API - ML5.JS - Google Teachable Machine

children.text: I had to control a javascript experience using a

data channel. Through this channel, I could connect my phone with my pc. Previously I used web sockets to do this but for this assignment I used WebRTC. The design of the experience didn’t matter. It was all
, so please don’t mind the quickly drawn illustrations and the design of the website.
I came up with the random idea to draw a simple scene with a dog floating by balloons. I connected a

to my web experience and based the height of the dog on the current temperature. The dog also wiggles and it’s wiggle speed is based on the current wind speed. When you connect your phone with the website by scanning the
, you will be able to manipulate the dog’s position with your phone with the buttons, or by pointing up or down in the camera of your phone. To achieve this, I trained a
. The video is sent to the computer with a WebRTC data channel. There is also a button on the phone which enables the dog’s position to be changed with the phone’s
